content: That's really interesting. Speaking of self-beliefs, I used to think I wanted to be a software engineer, but after attending a conference in February, I realized that my passion lies in data science. I've been reading books and watching tutorials on data analysis and machine learning, and it's amazing how much more excited I am about going to work every day. Do you think there's a way to use data science to identify patterns in career choices and help people discover their true passions?
